intro: Bigelovia brasiliensis, commonly known as the Brazilian sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to dry, tropical climates. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom during the dry season. It is often found in open habitats such as savannas and coastal dunes.
